result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Michael Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: *Pay Restitution in the amount of $379.59 to Gary D.  Restitution is to be paid BEFORE surcharges, costs and disbursements.

*Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period. Failure to pay amounts in full will result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
*Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
*Defendant also has to pay $928.00 to the Milwaukee County DA's Office for extradiction costs.  This is also to be paid BEFORE surcharges, costs and disbursements.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*No controlled substances or alcohol.
*No driving of any vehicle without a valid license.

*AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
*Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Adam Michael Clark, in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea/Sentencing date.  

Case adjourned to September 22, 2015 at 8:30am in Judge Conen's Court, Br. 30 for a Plea/Sentencing.

Defendant Adam Michael Clark in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Adam Michael Clark in custody.  Deann Heard for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is currently assigned to Branch 02, Judge Donald.  As of August 3, 2015 due to Judicial Rotation this case is reassigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Maurice Woulfe-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 30.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

**Defense to address bail on the next date.**

Defendant Adam Michael Clark in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Adam Michael Clark in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  ADA Carole Manchester approved quick date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam Michael Clark
Current: 1651 N 29th Street, Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 5300 West Wisconsin Avenue, Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53208
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Adam Michael Clark not in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 03-20-2015 at 01:30pm.
